page.title: 06AGRICULTURE AROUND WHALTON
page.content: There are 12 farms which lie completely or have the majoritory of their land within this survey block. Their sizes range from 35 to 400 acres with the average being 200-250 acres. 9 are owned by the families working them,2 are managed and there is 1 tenent farmer. Most of the farms are run on the traditional mixed farming of sheep, beef and arable. The average work force on each farm is 2. There are 2 modern dairy units with herds of around 100. One of these employs just 1 man whilst the other which also has a large (500),long established pig unit employs 4 men. A third dairy unit -Manor Farm, closed last year and is now totally arable relying on 1 man and contractors. On the next two pages there is more detailed information on two different types of farm within this survey block
